solution_line_template: First find the amount of dye each blouse takes: {dots_per_blouse} dots/blouse * {ml_per_dot} ml/dot = <<{dots_per_blouse}*{ml_per_dot}={dye_per_blouse}>>{dye_per_blouse} ml/blouse

Then multiply the dye used per blouse by the number of blouses to find the total amount of dye used: {dye_per_blouse} ml/blouse * {num_blouses} blouses = <<{dye_per_blouse}*{num_blouses}={total_dye_needed}>>{total_dye_needed} ml

Then divide the amount of dye needed by the amount of dye per bottle to find the number of bottles needed: {total_dye_needed} ml / {bottle_capacity} ml/bottle = <<{total_dye_needed}/{bottle_capacity}={bottles_needed}>>{bottles_needed} bottles
